article_headline: Pan Am shutdown puts employees out of work
article_text: MIAMI (AP) â€” Pan Am passengers scrambled to re-book flights during the heaviest travel time of the season and 7,500 employees found themselves out of work three weeks before Christmas when the once-glorious airline went under. The airline, which pioneered commercial aviation, abruptly shut down Wednesday after losing its battle to erase years of losses. Chanda Sharan of Jonesboro, Ga., sat in a baggage area at Miami International Airport with her two young daughters on their interrupted flight from Atlanta to Mexico City.
